hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is

we know that Trump has been building the

central bank the Fed is going to be
responsible for this economic disaster
and it's just not an idea it's actually
what's going to happen and the Biz the
IMF they've been fighting back they're
trying to create a narrative to shape
something so they created documents and
they're going back in time and they're
trying to show that when you raise the
interest rates it doesn't collapse the

just a minute but I wanted to talk about
how the entire economic system is
deteriorating and it's accelerating and
it's moving very very fast and we're
starting to see things really fall apart
right now yes you might not see it on
the corporate media but if you start to
look at this information and you start
to see what is happening you go back in
time you can see how the economy is
barely staying afloat right now yes they
can manipulate the statistical numbers
up to a certain point I mean you can
show the stock market is continually
moving up unemployment moving down GDP
incredible but if everyone is out of a

and retail sales are down the tubes and
the housing market collapses those
numbers at a certain point will be

they said that entire time that the

kept him at triple-a when everything was
falling apart think about that for a
second it was fake it was an illusion
the same things happening right now now
wolf Richter puts together a very nice
picture
the housing bubble and he tracks the
case-shiller homes and this is 20 cities
around the country and shows how the
housing bubble is much larger than the
2008 bubble if we look right now at the
case-shiller US home price index we see
that the first housing bubble was around
a hundred and eighty five or so then it
dropped all the way down to about 135
now it is above 225 so it's in 11.5
percent increase from the peak of July
2006 that was housing bubble number one
when we look at what has been going on
here we can see that growth now is
slowing everything is starting to change
and if we go through city by city we can
see that everything is changing if we
look at Seattle right now we can see the
first housing bubble we are 32 percent
higher than the bubble back in 2007 2008
2009 if we go back and look at Boston
the housing bubble back then well right
now we're eighteen point seven percent
higher than what it was back in the pre

Denver we're 55 percent higher than the
first housing bubble if we look at
Dallas we are 48 percent higher then the
housing bubble back in Oh ant oh 9 if we
look at Atlanta
we are 8 percent higher now Atlanta took
a huge fall during the recession I mean
they went down 37 percent so the housing
bubble in Atlanta was really pumped up
around 45 percent if we look at Portland
we are 26% higher than that
San Francisco 40% higher I mean you're
starting to get the picture here
what we're seeing is that the central
bank hedge funds investment companies
Wall Street they pumped these bubbles up
to Heights that we've never seen before
and if and not if but when these housing
bubbles pop because they always do we've
seen it back in 2008 we've seen it
before this and when it comes down it
comes down hard and remember this time
this wasn't 8 peeples driven bubble it
was a central bank that pumped this
bubble up alone and of course yesterday
used easy money they had hedge funds
investment companies banks buying up
homes trying to rent them if they can
keep them off the market just hold on to
them because a shortage in housing makes
the bubbles increase because people
think whoa a lot of people are looking
for homes there's no homes out there wow
I can't find anything and people start

know supply and demand so what we're
seeing here is that these bubbles have

four percent consensus forecast
it was the slowest growth rate since

is going to start to fall apart very
very quickly once all this goes and we

the Fed right now they're raising

now in the US now the EU they're trying

to come up with an Iran oil trade
payment vehicle and this is a huge
problem for them because there is no EU

they're afraid of what the United States

so once again Iran is in trouble here
and we can see that eventually what's

deal and all these countries well
they're gonna have to renegotiate now we

know they're going to be blamed now the
bank of all banks the Bank of
International Settlement they are
referring to a paper that is explaining

increase in the federal funds rate from
mid 2004 reinforced by higher policy
rates elsewhere did not prevent further
increases in risk taking in the
financial markets during this period
Turner wrote in a 2017 paper titled did
central banks cause the last financial
crisis will they cause the next now what
they're trying to do here is they're
trying to explain away why higher
interest rates will not have an effect
on the economy
now remember Paul Volcker he was being
interviewed with the New York Times and
he actually brought down the economy
with raising the interest rates but what
they're saying is it's different this
time actually it's much much worse and
yes it is different and we've never seen
interest rates this low and we know when
the interest rates hit a certain point
that's when the economy starts to fall
apart
and what the central bank likes to do is
they like to hit that point and then
they bring the interest rates down very
very quickly so it looks like nothing
really happened and for a period of time
within maybe a year it seems like
nothing is happening but the Avalanche
has already started you can't see it on
the top of the hill it looks like a
little bit of dust and it starts rolling

bigger but by the time it hits the

it was the interest rates that actually

hey it's been a year now had nothing to

kick in and once they hit the tipping

the rates very very quickly I'm not

mean they're dropping at full percentage

and if you notice it's coming from the

uh IMF out there trying to fight back

there was going to be this incredible

hmm sounds like cue future proves past

this is very difficult for the central

they're trying to make it as easy as

and you need to be prepared for this you
